chapter.title: DA - Data Access
chapter.para: Data Access (DA) is the interface to collect live data from different subsystems in order to analyze, visualize and monitor it. Also the data can be used by other applications for further processing.

The idea behind DA is to easily acquire and process only scalar values and only from the perspective or now. Other modules of OpenSCADA might have different perspective on the data (e.g. the HD interface has a focus on historical data).

sect1.title: Basic Concepts
sect1.para: The main concept for data processing in the DA interface is the Data Item Data ItemDI which holds the value information. The Browser is a hierarchical presentation of the data item structure on the server side.

The DA also splits up the two communication parties in server and client. The server has the function to gather data and provide it to the clients. In most cases there are several DA servers which provide data from different types of sub-systems (e.g. Modbus, JDBC, PLCs, etc.). DA servers can also be seen as drivers to different data sources.

sect1.title: The Data Item
sect1.para: Each data item provides exactly one value (the primary value). In addition to that primary value there might be several secondary values which contribute information to the primary value. Secondary values (or attributes) are a set of key/value pairs. Each data item can provide its own attributes but there are several common attributes which should be common to all, or most, data items.
